column4: How to increase resolution, do you think i will live with this 640x480? ...
Hello..
Hi :)
Will you help me?
yep
!ask | eth01
I have upgraded to 8.10
what video card are you using?
if its not an issue with preferences, its likely that the driver in xorg.con is falling back to vga
various things like "lsmod | grep nv" might help
as will grep nv /var/log/Xorg.0.log
lsmod lists all drivers running.  | sends the output to grep, which returns only lines with "nv"in them
and | is not "I", but rather the combo of shift+\  (on US qwerty keyboards at least)
interesting.  this is the virtual resolution.  eg, you've set the desktop to a size larger then the monitor can display
for me to be able to help, i'll need to know what is actually running at the moment
the way that I know to do this will involve using a terminal
yes, but i'm guessing it would take longer to set that up.  especially if you have a router or such in the way.
as a note, it does not seem that ssh (the simplest remote login" is accessible.  I'm guessing it would take longer to get that working.
if you type lsmod, do you see either nv or nvidia listed?
you need ssh to be running, and for no proxies to be in the way
the file /var/log/Xorg.0.log will contain a list of things xorg did, or didn't do.
